intro: Setcreasea leiandra var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular setcreasea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its scientific name. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
